{"id":1483493231,"question_id":3291,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 month, 2 weeks","timestamp":1734674441,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"0 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1483493231/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Find if Array Can Be Sorted","memory":"31.6 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    bool canSortArray(vector<int>& nums) {\n        int curMax = 0; //Track the largest number in the current segment (with equal number of set bits), fail fast if any number is less than the previous segment's largest.\n        int prevMax = 0;\n        int curBits = 0;\n        for(int num: nums) {\n            int bits = countBits(num);\n            if(bits!=curBits) {\n                curBits = bits;\n                prevMax = curMax;\n            }\n            if(num<prevMax)\n                return false;\n            curMax = max(curMax, num);\n        }\n        return true;\n    }\n    int countBits(int num) {\n        int ret = 0;\n        while(num>0) {\n            if((num&1) == 1)\n                ret++;\n            num = num>>1;\n        }\n        return ret;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"find-if-array-can-be-sorted","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
